message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.NE 

The paper proposes a new neural network model for human activity recognition from video data. The model is based on a modified version of the Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) recurrent neural network, which is a popular choice for processing sequential data. The modifications introduced in the paper aim to better capture the spatio-temporal dynamics of the video data, which suggests that the paper is likely to be relevant to the computer vision (cs.CV) and machine learning (cs.LG) sub-categories. Additionally, the paper proposes a new approach to modeling the information gain in the LSTM, which involves computing the derivative of the hidden states over time. This suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the artificial intelligence (cs.AI), multimedia (cs.MM), and neural and evolutionary computing (cs.NE) sub-categories.
